title: S - , S + and S Criteria
body:
Hi RIOT and LOL community


UPDATE:
I played Sona Support in ranked and i got 2/1/27 kda yet i only got an A+
Idfk what i did wrong now. 

ORIGINAL POST:
So i just had a game before and my kda was 24/2/16 (197 cs) and i was using a Sona in mid lane. I'm just wondering WHY wasn't that enough to get an S. I got the most kills in both teams and i died the least yet i only get an S-. Can someone please tell me what just happened and how do you exactly get an S or an S+? I'm on the road to my mastery level 7 with Sona.{{item:3070}} {{champion:37}}

replies.body:
It isn't a set score you need to achieve, it's all relative to how everyone else on the server is doing with the **same champ in the same role**.

From Riot:

> It’s based on the champion and role that you just played in a game. So, for example, we look at Annie mid differently to Annie support. We take a series of performance metrics and compare how you do to all other players in your region in your champion / position combination. It is percentile driven - so earning a high score means** you performed in the top x% of players** on that champ in that position. The grade itself governs the point gains.

[(Source)](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/features/champion-mastery)

[Basically grades similarly to a bell curve](http://study.com/academy/lesson/bell-curve-definition-impact-on-grades.html), meaning we have a server full of really good players. 

**Riot hasn't released a list of the factors that contribute to a high grade,** but I would suggest working on CS, objective assists, and possibly warding to bump up your grade that extra notch ♥

Well you just explained the OP's point.

Very few players play Sona mid, I would say under 0.1% tbh. This is supreme meta breaking, and even fewer go well, and then more of those people are trolls. Furthermore, 24/2/16 is absolutely outstanding, especially with 197 cs for the roaming obviously involved.

That is beyond no doubt worthy of S+.

thanks very much. i was just heart broken as well because i tried so hard not to die and my team just pretty much saves me as much as they can too. Both Tahm Kench (support) and Sona (Mid (me)) were kinda disappointed that we only got an S-

thanks for the kind words too

No we don't have a server full of good players. OCE gameplay is among the lowest in the world. 
The Chiefs got stomped and the Chiefs stomp OCE teams. 
OCE Diamond is like Koreas high Silver. 
There is not much difference between high silver and low platinum oce. I know a couple silvers that can smash platinums, heck I have even stomped some plats and I am bronze 4. I have watched a gold player smash a Diamond 1 player. 
The bell curve theory does not take into account the fortnight to fortnight patches containing nerfs and buffs to champs and items. 
Sona just got nerfed so what OP did defo deserved an s+!
The stupid thing is I can go heimer top get 300cs in 30 mins go 15 12  and get an s+ which makes no sense as I have gone 28 2 with only 120cs about the same time and only got an a+ even though the carry game I won but the high death game I lost. All that cs meant nothing as I wasn't helping the team when needed. So the current system creates selfish play where farming is more important than team objectives even more so when crates and mastery are tied to getting an s.

The thing with these "good players getting good scores and setting the bar for an S grade high" it is relative to the other players on the server. People on OCE playing sona mid must be getting good scores, setting the bar really high. If you went to another server, it may be easier/harder depending on how their players do.
 So your facts about our esports scene and relative rank system aren't actually relevant here. 

The bell curve isn't static, and probably does take into account patch changes, as the average scores will change as well and it will have to adjust for this. Unfortunately, this adjustment period isn't likely to happen immediately and would probably take a while to gather new info about players scores to re-adjust the grade boundaries. 

CS isn't the most important thing. It does have a big impact on grades, but so do other things such as ward scores and objective assists. I had 2 games (both approx 30 mins long) that ended with the same support score of 2/0/14. In one game I had 3 CS, the other I had 11. The one I had 3 CS was the one that I received an S grade. Why? Probably because my warding was so much better and I was at almost all of the towers/barons/drags to be taken.

The fact is that League of legends is an team orientated objective based game. The developers of the mastery grading system know this, and would have created their system with this in mind to avoid the "antisocial steal all the kills, hog all the farm" play style.

http://puu.sh/nVLRI/7bec9e45c0.jpg

In this picture, the gangplank got an S+,

I was playing Soraka and my score netted me a B+

Unbelievable isn't it :l


I don't think there's a lot of precision when it comes to determining as S+ especially since some of the possible prerequisites of obtaining a higher score doesn't always trying your best at your specific role. For example, Taking kills on a support seems to actually get you a much better chance at obtaining an S- or higher.
That's exactly what I was saying, somehow it's tied to farming and not team play.
i got 197 cs :/ cant believe thats still isnt enough
i had the same problem with aurelian sol. IIRc 26 kills 2 deaths 200+ cs only got a  A

The other day I got an S for having a decent score with over 400 cs our team probably lost because of my farming non stop but if I didn't do that and went for more kills instead I would of only got S- or A+

The thing is I find is that even with relic shield, you still have very slow wave clear unless you have high bases or something with some AOE burst like {{champion:53}}. The active does help clear, but only with an ally and up to 3 times. When I farm well, it's because I used something like a ZZ'rot to push lanes but that doesn't change that when you're trying to farm that someone like {{champion:157}} only needs to auto the wave once and they all die to a statikk shiv proc or something alike.

Of course this is assuming you build the general support items as opposed to something like a full ap build,

tl;dr a good score alone only nets A+ or maybe S- to get an S or S+ you need to have extremely good cs and the more cs you get the less your score matters.

I have had games like you described and got A+ then the next game had a much worse score but much more cs and gotten S

Actually they do heavily factor in cs even on supports, the S rank system actually suggests taking kills as a support because the average support doesn't take very many kills.

The system supports selfish play for a better grade.

24/2/16 should be a guaranteed S+ no matter if you had 3CS.

You're better off just doing what every other Sona does and go AP botlane where going 1/8/10 is an S.
